title: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When I answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, and then double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, there is no noticeable delay. However, if I repeat the same steps and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: It is expected that reverting the file contents should not take more time than simply closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open any file in the java editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. When prompted to save changes, choose 'no'.
4. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
5. Observe that there is no delay.
6. Repeat steps 3 and 4.
7. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
8. Observe that it takes approximately 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
